[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Web Archive file format for web content (WARC) Tools Phase III enhances web archive management tools, focusing on migration, validation, reporting, and QA.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: WARC Tools offers features for migration, validation, reporting, and QA to improve WARC usability.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: WARC Tools integrates with WARC-compliant systems and APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: WARC Tools provides GUI, command-line tools, and dashboards.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: WARC Tools supports x86 hardware and distributed setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: WARC Tools uses libraries like libwarc and external tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: WARC Tools uses HTTPS and SFTP for secure exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: WARC Tools is optimized for low memory usage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: WARC Tools is 24/7 available with failover.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: WARC Tools is customizable for workflows and migrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: WARC Tools connects with tools for validation and reporting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: WARC Tools offers ARC-to-WARC migration, validation, reporting, and QA tools.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: For archivists, engineers, and institutions managing web archives.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: WARC Tools depends on infrastructure and configurations.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: WARC Tools requires compliant WARC readers/writers and ARC/WARC files.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: WARC: Web Archive file format for web content.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with ARC and WARC file readers for data access.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support APIs for metadata extraction and reporting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support validation of migrated WARC content against ARC files (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow reporting on WARC files, including MIME type and status code summaries.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly GUI for migration and reporting tools.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support command-line tools with detailed help documentation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 1 million ARC records within 24 hours.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain performance for files up to 100GB.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata and logs for all migration and validation processes.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall support querying of migration logs by timestamp and file type.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with open-source licensing standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall support modular deployment for specific tools.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with the WARC ISO standard 28500:2017.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log critical actions for auditing and provide error notifications.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit, integration, and user testing validate compliance and scalability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, configuration files, and migration best practices.
[SEC] 5. References: WARC ISO 28500:2017, IIPC docs, and migration guides.
